model.components.move

Class Play

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.components.move.Move
      • model.components.move.Play

  • public class Play
extends Move
    One of the three most complex classes on the server side. The play class represents the connection between a player, the board and the blocks he would like to play. Therefore Play holds methods to validate if the board allows the placement of these blocks and also holds a method to actually execute this move.
    Author:
    Jeroen

      boolean validate(Player p, boolean firstMove)
      validate checks the current player's moves on legality, the following will be checked: It must be the current player's turn and he must have at least 1 block The player must own the blocks he entered The blocks must be placed in the same direction, x or y Defines Orientation to use in the validation of the row, type/colour check If all checks succeed, the move is valid, the score of the move will be calculated

      • Play

        public Play(Player p,

        Creates a new play object that will represent the move made by the player on the board b.
        Parameters:

        b - the board on which the blocks will be placed

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws IllegalMoveStateException
        execute fills the position on the board with a specified block of the player. execute() also adds the score of the move to the player's total amount.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Move
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveStateException - if the move has not yet been validated.

      • determineOrientation

        public boolean determineOrientation()
        determineOrientation checks whether all the entries are all on the same x or all on the same y coordinate, and if so, then orientation will be set to this value(X/Y).
        Returns:
        true if all entries are on the same x or y false if the move is not valid

      • validate

        public boolean validate(Player p,
                        boolean firstMove)
        validate checks the current player's moves on legality, the following will be checked: It must be the current player's turn and he must have at least 1 block The player must own the blocks he entered The blocks must be placed in the same direction, x or y Defines Orientation to use in the validation of the row, type/colour check If all checks succeed, the move is valid, the score of the move will be calculated
        Specified by:
        validate in class Move
        firstMove - tells it is the firstMove of the game or not
        Returns:
        valid

      • addBlock

        public void addBlock(Block b,
                     Board.Position p)
        Adds a new block to the move with the given position.
        Parameters:
        b - = block to be added
        p - = position where the block will be added
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveStateException - if the move is not valid
        MoveFullException - if the to be moved blocks are more then 6 blocks.

      • removeBlock

        public void removeBlock(Block b)
        removes the block with its position from the Move
        Parameters:
        b - the blocks that will be removed from the Move

        Returns:

      • getBlocksView

        public java.util.List<Block> getBlocksView()
        getBlocksView gives a list of Blocks which are requested to move. The method or class who requests for the blocks, can't change the List of blocks held by the Move. It just receives a copy.
        Specified by:
        getBlocksView in class Move
        Returns:
        the list of the to be moved blocks

      • getBlock

        public Block getBlock(Board.Position p)
